modal.available_in_osm: Available in OpenStreetMap with the URL:
modal.should_appear_soon: Object should appear on the map within 60 minutes.
modal.title: Information
modal.need_to_login: To add features you need to log in using OpenStreetMap account.
modal.click_login_button: Close this window and click login button at the top to log in.
modal.need_more_zoom: To add features you need to zoom in so the location that you provide is accurate.
modal.zoom_need_to_be: Zoom needs to be at level 15 minimum.
modal.about_project: OpenAEDMap is an open-data project which shows all Automated External Defibrillators (AED) around the world. The website is based on data from OpenStreetMap and is the result of OpenStreetMap Poland's association efforts. It was created in 2022 after changing the Polish website AED Mapa to a new design.
modal.about_osm: OpenStreetMap (OSM) is like a Wikipedia for maps. It's available to use for everyone and anybody can add objects to the map. You can use your OSM account to add AED locations directly from this site using a simple form.
modal.create_account: You can contribute too! Just create a free account on
modal.become_openaedmap_partner: Do you want to become OpenAEDMap partner?
modal.thanks_for_photo: Thank you for uploading the photo. It should be visible soon.
modal.thanks_for_report: Thank you for sending a report. It will be reviewed by the site administrators.

partners.gugik: Head Office of Geodesy and Cartography in Poland

photo.report_long_text: You can report the photo if it's bad quality, does not show the AED's location or is inappropriate in any way. Administrators of the site will review the report.
photo.license: All AED photos hosted by us are licensed under Creative Commons Zero (CC0 v1.0). By uploading your photo you agree to this license terms.
photo.license_short_description: In short this means that the photo can be used by anyone for any purpose. No attribution is necessary.

meta.meta_title: Open map of Automatic External Defibrillators (AEDs)
meta.meta_description: Map of AEDs (Automatic External Defibrillators) based on OpenStreetMap data. Our website makes it easy to find an AED defibrillator near you, which can be very helpful in life-threatening situations. AED defibrillators are devices that are used for cardiopulmonary resuscitation of people in cardiac arrest. With our map, anyone can quickly find the nearest defibrillator and help someone in need.
